title: Day One Overview
text:
The focus of Day 1 is string manipulation and managing data across files
String manipulation will involve:

Regular expressions (regex)
The functions str_detect, str_subset, str_replace

Managing data across files will involve:

The join family of functions

title: Day Two Overview
text:
The focus of Day 2 is functions and iterations
Functions
Iterations

title: Intermediate R
text:
In this workshop you will begin to learn intermediate level skills in the R programming language. There are many skills and tools that could be defined as “intermediate level”, and here we will work with just a small number. This workshop will be taught over two mornings from 9am - 1pm.
Day 1
Day 2

title: Intermediate R
text:
Prerequisites
To fully engage with the material in this workshop, you will need:
An Introductory level of R including:

Variable assignment
Mathematical and Boolean operators
Data modes
Importing data

Some familiarity with the tidyverse dialect of R, as shown here:

mutate() and filter()
group_by() and summarise()
The pipe: %>%
